articles.content:
Friendly gathering marks victory in Playa Giron Battle
   Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Ministry of the DPRK arranged a film show and friendly gathering in Pyongyang on April 20 to mark the 38th anniversary of the Cuban people's victory in the Playa Giron Battle.   Invited there were Jose Manuel Inclan Embade, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and embassy officials.   The participants first saw a documentary film on General Secretary Kim Jong Il's on-the-spot guidance over various fields.

Floral baskets laid to mark Sun's Day
   Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- President of Democratic Congo Laurent Desire Kabila laid a floral basket before Portraits of the President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il while Guinean President Lansana Conte laid a floral basket before the Portrait of the President to mark Sun's Day.   The floral baskets were placed before the portraits hung at Korean embassies in those countries. articles.content:
Greetings to Djibouti president-elect
   Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Djibouti president-elect Ismail Omar on April 19.   The message expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop and wished him success in his responsible work for the progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok meets Vietnamese guests
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam meets Choe Hong Hui
   Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Choe Hong Hui, president of the International Taekwon-do Federation, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.

articles.title: Honorary doctorate to Choe Hong Hui
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok meets Vietnamese guests
   Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea, today met and had a talk with the visiting delegation of the external relations commission of the communist party of Vietnam led by vice-chairman Pham Van Chuong.Present there were Choe Jin Su, vice-department director of the WPK Central Committee, and Le Xuan Vinh, Vietnamese ambassador to Korea.   The head of the delegation said that the Korean people would tide over difficulties and hardships and achieve greater success in the socialist construction under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
